h: Two killed in separate Road accidents
sub_h: Two people were killed in two separate Road accidents in Nashik on Monday and Tuesday. The accidents were reported at the Gangapur and Panchavati police stations. The Panchavati police said that 42-year-old Umesh Yadav, a resident of Adgaon and a native of Fatehpur in the Gaya District of Bihar, was speeding his bike on the flyover at Mumbaiagra Highway at around 1am on Tuesday when he lost control of his bike and rammed into the road divider. He was taken to Nashik Civil Hospital where he was declared brought dead. 25-year-old Atul Kumavat, a resident of Trimbak Road, was riding his bike from Utkarsha Nagar when he rammed his vehicle into the road divider at around 1130pm on Monday. Kumavat was rushed to the Civil Hospital where he was declared brought dead. Police officials said that overspeeding was one of the main reasons behind the accidents in both these cases.

h: Over 1,000 officials from Maharashtra get training to collect scientific data at road crash sites
sub_h: Over 1,050 officials from police, RTO and PWD departments in Maharashtra are now trained to gather information and detailed data scientifically from any road crash site across Maharashtra, deputy transport commissioner (road safety) Bharat Kalaskar said.

h: 22-yr-old biker killed in Road accident at Bhosari Phata
sub_h: A motorcyclist was killed after a private bus hit his vehicle in an attempt to overtake it on the Punemumbai Highway in Bhosari Phata early Tuesday. The bus driver fled the scene after the accident. The officer from the Bhosari Police said the accident occurred around 430 am. Pawar was riding his motorcycle from Akurdi towards Bhosari. The private bus too was plying on the same route in an attempt to overtake the bus hit the motorcycle Pawar lost control of his vehicle and fell on the road. He had suffered serious injuries in the accident and following this he was taken to a nearby hospital where he succumbed to his injuries during treatment. The bus driver has been identified and the police are searching for him. There have been other s involving private buses in the recent past. Two pedestrians died after they were hit by a private bus at Mali Mala on the Punesolapur Road in Loni Kalbhor around 6am on January 24. The two women had deboarded a bus and were crossing the road when a private bus heading from Latur to Pune hit them. Mon September 22 2022 a privatelyoperated luxury bus knocked down a 60yearold woman pedestrian at Gunjan Chowk on Pune-

h: 182 killed in 461 accidents in Nashik city in 2022
sub_h: In 2022, 182 people died in 461 accidents in Nashik City, India. The main reasons for these deaths were overspeeding and riding without helmets. Police officials said that an analysis of the data revealed that overspeeding was responsible for more than 70 of the fatalities. Additionally, 48 people died due to dangerous driving and 54 bikers had fatal accidents as they were not using helmets. Three others were killed due to wrongside driving and two died when they met with an accident while speaking on their cell phone. There are around 25 accident blackspots across the city. After the horrific accident at the Mirchi Hotel Chowk in October last year, the Nashik Municipal Corporation initiated steps to set up speed calming measures at these blackspots. Police Commissioner Ankush Shinde told TOI, "efforts will be made to bring down the number of s in the city. It is also necessary for people to follow the traffic rules and drive their vehicles cautiously for their own safety and the safety of others on the streets." There is also rising concern about the increasing number of vehicles on city roads every year, and thousands of new vehicles are added to city roads every year. This has led to traffic jams becoming common across the city. The traffic police said

h: Man killed in Road accident in Nashik city

h: CM announces 5L ex gratia for kin of deceased

The CM, Eknath Shinde, announced a compensation of Rs 5 lakh to the bereaved families. 23 people were injured, most of them workers on a packaging firm. The district administration will bear the entire cost of the treatment of the injured. The CM sought details about the accident from the divisional commissioner and district collector.

h: Bombay HC enhances payout to kin of accident victim by Rs 1 crore

h: Two friends killed as SUV hits container trailer in Navi Mumbai

h: Seven days into new year, 4 killed in Road accidents

One of the main reasons for these accidents is that drivers are speeding. The police are also trying to enforce traffic rules more strictly. There have been three accidents in Gangapur, one in Ambad, and one in Bhadrakali so far this year.

h: Engineering student dies after dumper hits his bike
sub_h: This is a story about a student who died after being hit by a truck while riding his motorcycle. The student was from a computer engineering program and was a final year student. The story says that the student's friends went out for a ride with him on Saturday and that after getting fuel at a nearby village, the student turned towards the main road and rode towards the side road where the accident happened. The truck driver hit the student's motorcycle and dragged him along for about 20 feet before he died. The truck driver has been arrested and is facing charges of negligent driving.

h: 2-year-old girl among 2 killed in separate Road accidents in Nashik

h: Cops spent 20 days in Varanasi on killer’s trail
sub_h: In 1994, Jagrani Devi's husband Rajnarayan Prajapati was away at work when she and her four minor children were killed in Kashimira. The killings came to light at 11pm when Rajnarayan returned home from work. Rajnarayan died in 2006 in a . Reports say that Rajnarayan had confronted the accused (Chauhan and the Saroj Brothers) in public and a fight had erupted. The accused had threatened Rajnarayan with dire consequences, and they were absconding at the time of the murder. In June 2021, the Kashimira Police received a tipoff about Chauhan, and they found out he had been working in Qatar since 2020. His passport details were obtained based on the details of a look out circular. Chauhan was clearly unaware that he was being arrested when he walked past immigration at the Mumbai Airport on Thursday. He was arrested and is being questioned about the whereabouts of the Saroj Brothers.

h: 22-year-old woman dies in Road accident

h: Opposition corners govt on potholed roads, accidents and Samruddhi
Murder ruled out in plumber death case
sub_h: A 54-year-old plumber named Sunil Chavan died after being hit by an autorickshaw in December. The police ruled out murder, and an investigation began after Chavan's family claimed that he had been murdered. The police scanned 300 cctv camera clips from Deccan Shivajinagar Bund Garden, Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Road, and other areas, and found that Chavan had been injured in a . Sunil Chavan's brother, Akshay Chavan, 25, was driving the autorickshaw. He took Chavan to Sassoon General Hospital, but left without informing the doctors. The next day, Chavan's body was found near Kamgar statue. A case of negligence causing death has been registered against the autorickshaw driver.

h: Insurance scheme for Road accidents to get approval in 15 days: Health minister

h: Fewer accidents, casualties same as last year in Nashik

However, at least 100 are twowheeler riders and as many as 45 pedestrians have died in s this year. The police and other departments concerned will continue to work to provide good driving conditions on the city roads, but the foremost responsibility is of the vehicle driver to ensure that his driving style does not endanger his life or that of others on the road.

h: Bus driver killed, 10 passengers injured in Road accident in Raigad

h: Nylon manja continues to find takers in spite of fatal accidents & NGT ban

h: Four people killed in 3 separate Road accidents in district

h: 10 months, 868 accidents, 253 dead, 953 injured: Nagpur traffic police study

A total of 868 accidents were reported in the 10 months, which included 239 fatal, 363 serious, and 249 minor accidents. These accidents claimed a total of 253 lives and 953 injured.

h: Former Maharashtra health minister Deepak Sawant injured in Road accident near Mumbai

h: Nashik: Cyclist killed in Road accident

While Mumbai ranked 32nd among cities with 588 road crashes in 2019 against 691 in 2018, Maharashtra was placed sixth among states with an 8.3% drop—27,286 cases in 2019 compared to 29,740 in 2018.

h: Family of fisherman in tribal village donates his organs, gives life to 3
sub_h: A family from a tribal village, Kati near Hardoli town in Bhandara district, showed great heart and agreed to donate organs of a 40-year-old man who died of severe brain injuries in a Road accident.

h: Naiknavare transferred, Ankush Shinde new Nashik CP
sub_h: Nashik commissioner of police Jayant Naiknavare has been transferred and will be replaced by Ankush Shinde, Pimpri Chinchwad police commissioner. An order in this regard was issued by the state home department on Tuesday.

h: Nagpur's crime cases drop by 5.29 per cent in 2022 compared to 2021: Police
sub_h: Another major concern for Nagpur city police is crime against women.

h: 5 days after woman’s hand crushed by truck, police yet to register FIR
sub_h: Five days after a truck crushed a woman’s hand under its wheels on London/Orange City Street Project road, Rana Pratap Nagar Police are yet to bring the Road accident on record, allegedly to shield a contractor of Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) and the truck driver.

h: Container truck driver rams multiple vehicles; 1 killed in Nashik
sub_h: A speeding container truck knocked down multiple vehicles in the Yeola area of Nashik rural on the Yeola-Manmad Road around 7 pm on Tuesday, killing one man on the spot and leaving five others injured. The Yeola police arrested the driver and produced him before the court on Wednesday.

h: Journalist crushed after article against refinery
20% fatal accidents in Nashik region are hit-&-run cases
sub_h: In 2022, there were 2700 fatal accidents in five districts of the Nashik region. 20 of these were hitandrun cases. The Nashik Range Special Inspector General of Police, Mr. Shekhar Patil, has instructed the superintendents of police in the five police units to ensure that the accused in hitandrun cases are arrested and tried in court. This is in response to the increasing number of accidents on roads, most of which are hitandrun cases. Mr. Patil also said that in 2021, there were 2530 fatal accidents in the region. 2120 of them were detected, while 16 were not detected. Mr. Patil has instructed the sps to ensure that the undetected hitandrun cases are detected and officers of the rank of police subinspector and above be given the work of detecting such cases. This will help to catch the drivers involved in hitandrun cases and make them more likely to be caught. However, by doing so, the drivers also leave the accident victim on the road when he or she can be saved if taken to the hospital at the earliest.

h: To treat stray dogs with cruelty is unacceptable in civil society: Bombay HC
sub_h: "To hate stray dogs and treat them with cruelty can never be an acceptable approach from persons of civil society, as such cruelty would be against the Constitutional ethos and statutory provisions," said Bombay high court bench of Justices Girish Kulkarni and R N Laddha on Monday to managing committee and other members of a cooperative housing society in suburban Mumbai.

h: Widened Dabha ring road witnesses 42 deaths in 4 years
sub_h: People living along the Dabha ring road from New Katol Square to Amravati Road, who were happy after the state’s public works department widened and concretized the stretch, are now concerned about Road accidents and speeding vehic

h: 17-year-old girl died in accident, family donates her kidneys, liver in Nagpur
sub_h: Family members of a 17-year-old girl student in the city, who died in a Road accident, decided to donate her kidneys and liver to needy patients. Zonal Transplant Coordination Centre (ZTCC) Nagpur informed that the organs gave three young patients a new lease of life. As per the wish of the family of the donor, authorities have not revealed their identity.

h: 182 killed in 461 accidents in Nashik city in 2022
sub_h: Overspeeding, rash driving and helmetless riding were the main reasons for the death of 182 people in 461 accidents in Nashik city in 2022, revealed the data compiled by the Nashik city police.

h: In Nashik 3,600 bikers slapped with Rs 18 lakh fine for not wearing helmets in 11 days
sub_h: The Nashik police have recovered Rs 18 lakh fine from helmetless bikers in 11 days. The aim is to spread awareness among bikers on the use of helmets, said police, adding that they even announce the name of spots where the drive would be undertaken beforehand.

h: Pune: Leopard dies in accident on highway
sub_h: A nine-month-old male leopard was hit by a speeding vehicle on the Pune-Nashik highway at Kalamb village in Ambegaon tehsil on Sunday.

h: MLA Kadu hit by unidentified biker in Amt, being treated at Ngp
Only 32 stretches in city prone to jams: Nagpur traffic police survey
sub_h: Frequent traffic jams are witnessed in almost every locality. But according to a study conducted by Nagpur traffic police, there are only 32 stretches across the city that are prone to frequent traffic jams. The study was conducted by traffic branches of 10 zones.

h: Maharashtra: Sun brings out snakes, 50 rescued and released
sub_h: In winter when snakes tend to regulate their body temperature by finding warmth under the sun, they become more vulnerable to Road accidents, conflicts with humans, and getting stuck in places.

h: ICU patient suffers burns; doctor & hospital employees booked in Pune
sub_h: The Koregaon Park police have registered a case of negligence causing burn injuries to a 70-year-old patient under treatment in the ICU of a city hospital against the doctor and the staff attending him.

h: ICU patient suffers burns; doc & hospital employees booked
sub_h: A 70-year-old patient is treated in the ICU of a city hospital after slipping into hypothermia. The patient's son, a lawyer, files a complaint for negligence against the doctor and the staff attending him. The hospital's joint medical superintendent tells the media that the patient was brought to the hospital at 1am on January 5 in a comatose state, and that his vitals were unstable. The patient was operated on January 5 with highrisk consent, and did not show any improvement. The patient went into hypothermia on January 5 evening, and was rewarmed to increase his body temperature. The patient suffered superficial burns on his abdomen, covering an area of around 4. The patient's son tells the media that the condition of his father was stable after the surgery, but that he suffered burn injuries because of the negligence of doctors and nurses. The incident could have been averted had they remained vigilant.

h: PWD plans steps to reduce accidents at Palse chowk in Maharashtra
sub_h: The state public works department will be making changes at the Palse village chowk to prevent accidents on Pune highway, where a horrific accident took place earlier this month.

h: Cops seek more signboads on Nashik-Mumbai highway
sub_h: The city traffic branch has written to the National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) to put up signboards on the highway passing through the city. Most of the existing signages are faded and need to be replaced. Moreover, new sign boards are also needed on the highway.

h: Two killed in separate accidents
sub_h: Two people were killed in separate Road accidents in the Sarkarwada and Adgaon areas of the city. A 70-year-old woman, resident of Sinnar, was killed in the Adgaon area, when she was knocked down by a speeding biker.

h: Kamptee Road riddled with potholes, agencies pass buck in Maharashtra
sub_h: Two busy stretches of Kamptee Road, including the one from LIC Square to Mount Road T-point, have turned into accident prone spots due to bad condition of the carriageway.

h: A doctor in shorts giving long-life tips at literay summits
Pune: 4 people killed in separate accidents
sub_h: Three motorcyclists and a pedestrian were killed in separate Road accidents since Monday in Hadapsar, Loni Kalbhor and on the Pune-Ahmednagar highway stretch under the Airport police.

h: High road fatalities in rural Nashik a concern
sub_h: The rural belt of north Maharashtra has registered maximum casualties in Road accident in the past two-and-a half years.As per the available figures, as many as 6,266 people lost their lives in Road accidents in North Maharashtra, out of which the figure for Nashik rural stands at 2,030.

h: Nashik: Biker mowed down by truck driven on wrong side
sub_h: A 20-year-old biker was killed in a Road accident after he was knocked down by a speeding truck coming from the wrong side of Peth Road at around 12.15 am on Friday.

h: Truck ferrying ore crushed Gadchiroli driver, suspect cops
sub_h: Mystery over the death of a 31-year-old truck driver, Nikesh Chokhare, near Maddigudam iron ore stock yard near Yelchil village in Aheri taluka in south Gadchiroli on Monday continues as the investigators are yet to identify the vehicle involved in the suspected hit-and-run case.

h: 60% brain injuries due to accidents, avoidable: Doctors
Thane: Union minister Kapil Patil stops convoy, admits accident victim to hospital
sub_h: Union minister of state for Panchayati Raj, Kapil Patil, who was on a visit to Murbad, looking at an accident on road immediately stopped his convoy and admitted the injured driver to a nearby hospital.

h: Motorists at risk as safety norms ignored in Amravati Road works
1.5k+ killed on Mum-Goa h’way
sub_h: As many as 1,512 people lost their lives in Road accidents on the Mumbai-Goa highway between 2012 and 2022, state PWD minister Ravindra Chavan told the state assembly. “A total of 6,692 accidents took place on the stretch, and 1,512 people lost their lives,” he said.

h: Yavatmal gynaecologist Dr Surekha Berlota dies in accident
sub_h: A well-known gynaecologist of Yavatmal Dr Surekha Berlota was killed in a ghastly Road accident on the national highway between Hyderabad and Nirmal on Tuesday, while three others sustained injuries.

h: Pune-Mumbai Expressway stretch saw more crash deaths in 2022 than 2021
sub_h: The stretch between Kiwale toll post and Amrutanjan Point on the Pune-Mumbai expressway saw as many as 28 Road accident deaths last year, up from 22 in 2021.

h: Boy's speeding motorcycle on wrong side crashes into car in Pune
sub_h: A boy (16) suffered serious back injury and two other teenagers (15 and 18) riding pillion on his bike fractured their legs after the motorcycle, on the wrong side of the road, collided with a car on January 2 at Ambi village in Maval taluka.

h: Mumbai: Cyrus Mistry cremated in Worli crematorium
sub_h: Former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry was cremated in Mumbai on Tuesday. Mistry, 54, who died in a car accident, was cremated as per Hindu customs in an electric crematorium at Worli in central Mumbai. Mistry and his friend Jahangir Pandole were killed in a in neighbouring Palghar district of Maharashtra on Sunday afternoon.

h: Cyrus Mistry accident: Hong Kong Mercedes-Benz experts arrive
sub_h: A team of Mercedes-Benz officials from Hong Kong arrived in Mumbai on Monday to inspect the car which crashed last week, killing former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry and his friend, and injuring two other occupants, a police officer said.

h: Udvada high priest condoles shocking death of philanthropist
sub_h: The Udvada high priest, Dastoor Khurshed Dastoor, offered his condolences to the Pallonji family on Sunday and said he met Cyrus Mistry on Sunday morning when he had come to pay respects at the Iranshah fire temple in Udvada in Gujarat. "His death has come as a terrible shock to the Parsi community," he said, while speaking to the media.

h: Heavy rain disrupts traffic movement in Mumbai
sub_h: Vehicular traffic in the city was disrupted following heavy rain on Friday. Additional traffic police were deployed to guide motorists.

h: Pune: Three rob injured man of cash, goods worth Rs 56,000
sub_h: Three men robbed an injured Road accident victim of cash, a cellphone and his motorcycle, totally worth Rs 56,000, in the ghat section near Khed on October 26. The Pune rural police on Tuesday tracked and arrested the trio and recovered the stolen bike.

h: Pune: Junnar leopard deaths in wells, on highways a worry
sub_h: The high number of accidental deaths of leopards in Junnar over the last four years has become a major worry for the state forest department.

h: Dwarka, KK Wagh College areas most accident-prone
sub_h: With 21 Road accidents in the Dwarka area and 13 near K K Wagh College in the last three years, these two places have emerged as the most accident-prone spots in the city. Nashik city has 15 black spots.

h: Man accused of killing 4 kids in Mira road caught at Mumbai airport after 28 years
sub_h: Over 28 years after a woman and her four minor children were murdered in Mira Road, the police got their first breakthrough with the arrest of Rajkumar Chauhan, now 47, who arrived from Qatar at the city airport on Thursday.

h: Nashik Municipal Corporation to engage new agency to maintain traffic signals
sub_h: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has decided to engage a new agency to maintain all 47 traffic signals in the city for one year.

h: Nashik: Pillion rider dies in accident on highway
sub_h: A 45-year-old man was killed in a Road accident on the Mumbai-Agra highway in front of the Panchavati College in Nashik city.The man was riding pillion on a scooter, which was knocked down by a speeding truck. The deceased has been identified as Santosh Pal, a resident of Satpur.

h: 734 deaths in 1,927 accidents in Nagpur, yet RTO gets mere Rs 2.05 lakh Road Safety Fund
sub_h: Though the district witnessed 734 fatalities in 1,927 Road accidents in 2021 alone and over 60 black spots have been identified which need immediate corrective measures, the transport department comprising City, East and Rural RTOs has received a minuscule Rs2.05 lakh as Road Safety Fund (RSF).

h: Palghar: Man who lost both legs in accident to get Rs 73 lakh
sub_h: A 44-year-old man who lost both legs in a Road accident in 2018 has been awarded a compensation of Rs 73 lakh by a Lok Adalat in Palghar district.

h: Nagpur: Cop dies after bike jumps off speed-breaker
sub_h: A 48-year-old head constable Rajendra Mishra was killed in a Road accident after his bike jumped off a speed-breaker near police headquarters. He had sustained severe head and leg injuries on September 13 and was declared dead on Monday at a private hospital.

h: 82 died in 135 accidents from 2019 to 2021 at Nashik city black spots
sub_h: The Mirchi Hotel junction, where Saturday’s bus-truck collision on Saturday killed 12 and left 40 injured, is among the 15 identified black spots in Nashik city, senior police officers have said.

h: Mumbai: No let-off for scooterist who hit couple, caused toddler injuries
sub_h: Refusing to grant leniency, a magistrate's court sentenced a 24-year-old student to 6 months' rigorous imprisonment for attempting to flee after ramming his bike into a couple in Andheri in 2019, causing their 1.5-year-old daughter to fall out of their arms and suffer a head injury.

h: Brain-dead girl, 10, becomes youngest organ donor in Pune
sub_h: A 10-year-old brain-dead girl, who suffered fatal injuries in a Road accident, became the youngest organ donor in the Pune zone after her parents consented to donate her vital organs on November 7, saving three patients with life-threatening conditions.

h: Donation on cardiac death can grow organ pool by 10%: Experts
Mumbai: Woman thrown off auto, dies; hubby booked for rash driving
sub_h: A 49-year-old woman from Jogeshwari died after she was thrown out of an auto that her husband was driving when he applied emergency brakes in Powai on Wednesday. Taking suo motu cognisance of the incident, the Powai police booked the husband for rash and negligent driving.

h: Pune: NCP opposes civic hospital for stray dogs in Hadapsar
sub_h: After the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) finalised the work order to build a hospital for stray animals in Hadapsar's Ramtekdi Industrial Area, the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) has opposed the move. NCP workers protested outside the PMC main building, alleging that projects that could cause trouble to residents are often set up in Hadapsar, like the dumping yard at Uruli Devachi.

h: 24-yr-old accident victim’s organs help give new lease of life to 3 patients
Maharashtra: 108 ambulance has helped 80 lakh patients in 8 years
sub_h: Maharashtra Emergency Medical Services (MEMS), more popular as 108 ambulance service, has reached a milestone — more than 80 lakh patients saved since its launch in January 2014.

h: Traffic police study suggests ways to make flyovers safe
Nashik: Police, NHAI plan measures to reduce accidents on highway
sub_h: With 272 Road accidents, including 112 fatal ones, in the past three-and-a-half years on the Mumbai-Agra highway passing through Nashik city, the police and National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) officials held a joint meeting to brainstorm over preventive measures that can be taken to

h: Campaign to reduce accident black spots launched in Nashik
sub_h: Kulwant Kumar Sarangal, the additional director general of police (traffic), on Tuesday expressed his concerns that although the conditions of roads have improved, the number of Road accidents in the state has not declined.

h: Thane: Kin of cook killed in 2019 awarded Rs 19 lakh by tribunal
sub_h: The Thane Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) recently awarded a compensation of Rs 19.68 lakh to the kin of a 24-year-old cook following his death in a 2019 Road accident.

h: 33% rise in fatal accidents in Pune this year as against 2019
sub_h: The roads in the city, including highways passing through it, recorded 309 accident-related fatalities this year so far, registering a rise of 33% as compared to 206 such casualties in the pre-pandemic year of 2019, data available with the Pune traffic police has revealed.

h: Times NIE Principals' Seminar: Learning the importance of road safety
sub_h: The state government is identifying black spots across the city to prevent Road accidents and promote safety, said MMRDA metropolitan commissioner SVR Srinivas, while the city's traffic chief Rajvardhan Sinha pushed for the inclusion of road safety in school curricula.

h: Helmet drive: Over 3,400 pillion riders fined, 61% from south Mumbai
sub_h: On the first day of their campaign against those who ride pillion without wearing a helmet, the traffic police issued challans to 3,421 individuals across the city, though 70% of them were from south Mumbai.

h: Nashik rural has most black spots in Maharashtra: SP
sub_h: Nashik rural has the highest number of black spots in the state, which are accident-prone spots in the country, said superintendent of police (Nashik rural) Sachin Patil. The rural areas have 98 black spots.

h: Thane: Mishap claim fake, two cops among 3 face the music
sub_h: Dismissing an accident claim of two brothers holding it as fake and frivolous, the Thane Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) has ordered action against three including two policemen for submitting fake claim.Rejecting the claim, MACT member HM Bhosale noted, “..

h: 2 die, 10 injured as car rams into parked truck without tail lights
Maharashtra: Collector Rajesh Deshmukh orders correction of 44 accident-prone black spots in district
sub_h: Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has said the authorities responsible for roads should take corrective measures at the 44 black spots identified on state and national highways in the district to put a check on accidents.

h: Father of girl in vegetative state can withdraw Rs 1 crore: Bombay HC
sub_h: Bombay high court permitted the father of a girl in a vegetative state after a Road accident to withdraw Rs1.1 crore deposited in court by Western Railways that owned the errant vehicle, pending hearing of the appeal filed in the case.

h: No helmet? No entry in govt offices for staff and visitors
Navi Mumbai: Two cops return Rs 4 lakh found in accident victims' scooter
sub_h: Two beat marshal constables, Manohar Patil and Kishor Kardile, were felicitated for their honesty on Tuesday after they secured Rs 4 lakh belonging to a couple who died in a Road accident and deposited it at the police station. The money was handed over to the victims' son after the felicitation.

h: 2.3 lakh motorists challaned last year in Nashik city
sub_h: The traffic police in Nashik city challaned 2.33 lakh erring motorists for violating various traffic-related norms last year. Most of the cases pertained to over-speeding, parking in no-parking areas, not wearing helmets or seatbelts and wrong-side driving.

h: 28 intersections, 9 midblocks accident-prone spots: Study
NMC razes encroachments near Mirchi hotel junction
sub_h: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) undertook a massive anti-encroachment drive at the Mirchi hotel chowk, demolishing about a dozen illegal structures, on Thursday. Among the properties razed was a section of the Mirchi hotel, after which the junction has been named.

h: Family fights, animal rescue: Understaffed Pune fire department fields all calls
sub_h: Some 75% of the calls the city fire brigade answered till August this year involved non-fire incidents, data from the department has shown.Only 24% of the calls — 793 out of the total 3,288 analysed till August this year — were linked to fire and short-circuit incidents.

h: Pandoles were owners of the iconic Duke's brand
sub_h: "Good morning. I am sorry to disturb you early morning, but I need your help. Along Western Express highway in the disguise of signage for traffic, they have put up humongous hoardings on poles and pillars on the road... They are in total contravention of guidelines," Anahita Pandole texted TOI last week.

h: Clarify your statement on Anand Dighe: Kin and loyalists to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde
sub_h: Political circles are abuzz following chief minister Eknath Shinde's recent veiled statement on his mentor Anand Dighe and the circumstances leading to his death. Dighe loyalists and his nephew Kedar Dighe have sought a clarification on the statement. Dighe had met with a and died in hospital in 2001.

h: Maharashtra: PMPML e-bus hits motorcycle, runs over biker on Alandi Road
sub_h: A biker was killed in a Road accident near the Army Public School on Alandi Road around 6.30pm on Friday after a PMPML e-bus hit his two-wheeler on the rear end.

h: Nagpur: Marc-ing potholes and filling them up
sub_h: City NGO MARC, which is involved in creating awareness on Road accidents in the district, has taken up repair of uneven patches of cement roads in the city, especially in the South-West Assembly constituency. This even as road construction agencies are not repairing tar roads and cement roads are developing cracks.

h: CP bans parking of trucks on city roads from today
10 killed, 23 hurt as bus, truck collide on Sinnar-Shirdi highway in Maharashtra
sub_h: Ten people, including four women and four children, were killed and 23 others were injured in a head-on collision between a luxury bus and a truck on the Sinnar-Shirdi highway (NH-160) at 6.30am on Friday.

h: Snake bites to suicide: 9% of Maharashtra's Covid toll in January 'unnatural'
sub_h: As many as 78 citizens who died of hanging, electrocution, homicide, snake bite, poisoning, drowning and Road accidents were counted among the Covid casualties after their nasal swabs that were drawn posthumously tested positive for Covid-19 at 20 state-run medical colleges and hospitals this January.

h: Maharashtra: Another female leopard knocked dead on NH-7
sub_h: Another young female leopard was knocked dead on the Madhya Pradesh side of Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR) near the Khawasa border on Thursday afternoon on the widened NH-44 (NH-7). This is the second such incident in the last 20 days.

h: Pune bridge pile-up: Truck hit multiple vehicles after driver switched off engine on slope, say police
sub_h: The driver of the truck, which hit several vehicles on Mumbai-Bengaluru highway in Maharashtra's Pune district and caused a pile-up, had apparently switched off its engine on a bridge slope resulting in the accident, a police official said on Monday.

h: Leopard dies in accident on Nashik-Trimbakeshwar road
sub_h: Officials from the Nashik West forest department informed that a four-year-old male leopard was killed after being hit by a speeding vehicle on the busy Nashik-Trimbakehwar Road late on Wednesday.The incident took place near Belgaondagha village located on the outskirts of Nashik city.

h: Mumbai: Devendra Fadnavis orders detailed probe into accident
sub_h: Deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday ordered a detailed investigation into the accident which resulted in the death of former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry. "Shocked and deeply pained to know about the demise in an unfortunate accident near Palghar. Spoke to DGP and instructed for detailed investigations," Fadnavis tweeted.

h: Bike ambulances a lifesaver for residents in Nandurbar villages
sub_h: Dilwarsinh Padvi received a call on his cellphone a few days ago from an Asha worker of Varphali, a remote village in Nandurbar district, asking him to immediately rush in with his bike ambulance and shift to a hospital an ice cream vendor severely injured in a .

h: 45% of PWD stretches need immediate fixes: Maharashtra minister Ravindra Chavan
sub_h: The PWD minister, Ravindra Chavan, told TOI that 45% of the roads under his department needed urgent repairs.

h: 2 elderly men killed in hit-and-run in Nashik
sub_h: Two elderly men were killed in a Road accident in the Adgaon area of Nashik on Thursday night after the scooter they were riding on was hit by a truck.

h: Drones for donated organ transport to be a norm soon: Experts
Cyrus crash probe points out bad road geometry
sub_h: A probe into the Road accident that killed ex-Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry has revealed that the car he was in crashed due to speeding beyond the 40kmph limit on that stretch and probable overtaking from the left. It was conducted by the NGO Save Life Foundation into the accident on Surya river bridge near Charoti village in Palghar district.

h: Nashik top cop writes to NHAI to prevent highway accidents
sub_h: The Nashik city police have expressed concern over the rising number of accidents and deaths occurring on the national highways passing through the city.

h: Mumbai: Sea link mishap accused blames stationary vehicles and toll staff
sub_h: Seeking bail, Irfan Bilkiya, arrested last week for causing the October 5 Bandra-Worli Sea Link pile-up in which five people were killed and 13 injured, said in the magistrate's court that he was a victim of the incident and that the accident was an outcome of contributory negligence on behalf of the individuals who voluntarily stopped their cars in the no-stopping zone as well as the sea link toll employees and the management, who he said are responsible for following the SOP in an accident.

h: Father & son killed as speeding lorry hits car in Maharashtra
sub_h: A man and his teenaged son were killed in a Road accident along the Islampur-Ashta road in Sangli district on Tuesday evening.

h: There will be earthquake if I started speaking, says Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde
sub_h: Questioning Thackeray's decision to join hands with the NCP and Congress, Shinde on Saturday also said he knew what happened to late Sena leader Anand Dighe.

h: ₹4L was for Haj, cops return it to couple’s son
sub_h: Two constables of Taloja police station, Manohar Patil and Kishor Kardile, were felicitated on Tuesday for securing and returning Rs 4 lakh found in the scooter of a couple who died in a Road accident.

h: Two deaths on Agra highway in two days
sub_h: A 45-year-old man was run over by an unidentified motorist on the Mumbai-Agra highway in the jurisdiction of the Ambad police station on Monday evening. The police have registered a case of accidental death.

h: Days after being hit by minor riding 2-wheeler, youth dies of injuries
To hate stray dogs not acceptable approach from persons of civil society: Bombay HC
sub_h: “To hate stray dogs and treat them with cruelty can never be an acceptable approach from persons of civil society, such cruelty would be against the Constitutional ethos and statutory provisions,” said Bombay high court bench of justices Girish Kulkarni and R N Laddha sounding a “word of caution” on Monday to managing committee and other members of a society.

h: Pune: Waterlogging, uprooted trees calls flood civic helplines
sub_h: Helplines of the civic body and other agencies were on Wednesday flooded with calls from residents complaining about waterlogging, uprooted trees and seeking repair of roads, after heavy showers.

h: Helmetless riders account for 57.81% of violations, no seatbelts 4.8%: Data
Mumbai: 2 cadaver organ donations take this year's count to 28
sub_h: Two cadaver organ donations in a row have facilitated a set of combined transplants across city hospitals. Besides saving multiple lives, the donations by the families of a 36-year-old man and a 44-year-old have taken the year's cadaver donation count to 28 in the city.

h: Pune: Hospital trains transgenders to be first responders to mishaps
sub_h: Lokmanya Hospital has initiated a first aid training programme for transgender persons, who are generally spotted at traffic signals and are therefore likely to witness Road accidents.

h: 2 leopards die of road hits, one on NH-7 other at Ramtek
Mandals too buy insurance for their govindas
sub_h: While the Shinde government has announced insurance for govindas, in any case, with Gokulashtami coming up on August 19 (Friday), dahi handi teams are making sure to purchase insurance for their players who will head out to break the pot.

h: Cyrus Mistry cremated in Worli; Ratan Tata's stepmom, 92, attends in wheelchair
sub_h: The last rites of Cyrus Mistry, former Tata Sons chairman, were performed at Worli crematorium Tuesday. Mistry, 54, and his friend Jehangir Pandole were killed in a Road accident along the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway Sunday.

h: Biker falls into trench on poorly lit road, dies
7 of 10 Indians don’t use back seat belt: Study
sub_h: In less than a month, three high-profile citizens died on the spot in two accidents despite sitting at the rear, considered the safest position in case of front-end collisions.

h: Pedestrians account for 10 of 18 deaths in Nashik roads in Sept
Brain-dead girl gives new life to boy with heart condition
sub_h: The family members of a brain-dead girl (14) donated her heart to a boy of the same age suffering from a severe cardiac condition, giving him a new life. The transplant surgery was carried out at the Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences (AICTS) on May 30.

h: 85-year old woman dies after being robbed during morning walk in Maharashtra
sub_h: An 85-year-old woman, who was on her routine morning walk on early Thursday morning at Moi village near Chakan, died after she was assaulted by two unidentified robbers with a sharp weapon.

h: Nearly 1 in 5 road deaths in Mumbai caused by hit and run
sub_h: Deaths in hit-and-run cases, in which pedestrians and two-wheeler riders are mainly the victims, comprise over 30% of Road accident fatalities in the country, according to the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB). In Mumbai, of 1,681 deaths between 2017 and 2020, over 17.5% were hit-and-run deaths. This proportion for Maharashtra during the same period was much higher, at over 23%.

h: 18 more accident-prone spots in Nagpur in 2021
sub_h: Contrary to the claims of both the central and state governments about paying special attention to accident-prone spots on Nagpur roads, the number of such black spots has increased in the last one year.

h: RESQ treats, rehabilitates seven Bonnet Macaques
sub_h: Seven Bonnet Macaques that were earlier admitted to the RESQ Wildlife Transit Treatment Centre (TTC) recently cleared every rehabilitation milestone and were certified fit to be released together into a suitable habitat.

h: Nashik: Jalkhed village residents demand measures to prevent accidents on Peth highway
sub_h: People residing in Jalkhed village located between Umrale and Golashi Phata on the Peth Road are worried about the rising number of road fatalities on the Nashik Peth highway.They have written to various departments to look into the issue and take measures to prevent the accidents.

h: Maharashtra: Man crushed to death by bus after his scooty bumps into pothole in Kalyan

However, she did not live to see her dream come true. Barely seven months after Rajeshwari Swaminathan met with a tragic end in a , her daughter, Soumya, got a chance to play the world championships at Oropesa del Mar in Spain last year, where she finished a creditable 11th. Though she had finished joint seventh along with four others, she had to remain content with the 11th spot because of her fewer progressive points (41).
